Design Communication and Testing Strategy: (A) Producing Effective Media

Design strategy can be defined as a structured approach that merges tactical business insights with the demands of the end-user, thereby facilitating the creation of highly efficient communication design, products, or services. In the Design Communication and Testing Strategy module, students will develop their understanding of the dynamics between producing a campaign, understanding an audience, and responsibility to stakeholders. They will explore the role of hierarchy in controlling the meaning of messages and how to shape communications strategically. The syllabus aims and learning outcomes of this module A prepare the student with a foundation and skillset on which to build and progress into the module B in year 3 semester 2.

Learning Objectives for this module:

+  Investigate the relationship between design, audience, and stakeholders in communication design.

+  Utilise typography and audio-visual presentation skills to optimize message transmission.

+  Explore the use of prototyping and testing strategies to refine design processes.

+  Execute and assess social media marketing campaigns following strategic principles.
